intro: Palaua scabra, commonly known as the rough palaua, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and showy yellow flowers. It typically grows in coastal areas and thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Palaua scabra is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
